intro: Euphrasia alpina, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Euphrasia alpina is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
